Class TwoWaySerialComm

    • Constructor Detail

      • TwoWaySerialComm

        public TwoWaySerialComm(Thread_Queue TQ,
                        ThreadQueueCmd cQ,
                        ThreadQueueRcv rQ,
                        java.lang.String ahrsModel)
        Constructor
        Parameters:
        TQ - The thread-safe communications link between AHRSRealTime (which loops while receiving the AHRS data and sending it to the graphics objects) and AttRecv.
        cQ - The thread-safe communications link between AttGraphicsContainer (contains the GUI elements for setting up and running the simulation) and AttComm (sends the data packet request to the AHRS).
        rQ - This is the thread-safe communications link between AttGraphicsContainer (contains the GUI elements for setting up and running the simulation) and AttRecv (receives and processes the AHRS data packet).
        ahrsModel - The selected AHRS model.

    • Method Detail

      • connect

        public void connect(java.lang.String portName)
        This is the main serial communications method, the instance of its class is launched from AttGraphicsContainer.java.

        Instances of DataStore (common data) and Thread_Queue are passed through the constructor.

        1. checks to see if the serial port is available (the string value is passed in the method argument.

        2. creates a CommPort object and verifies that the serial port is a valid RS-232 port (not an RS-485 port, etc.)

        3. verifies that the commPort object is the same type as the SerialPort object

        4. creates an instance of SerialPort and sets the communications parameters

        5. creates an instance of InputStream (data coming from the serial port) and OutputStream (data going to the serial port).

        Parameters:
        portName - The String value of the serial port number (e.g. "COM3").
